ACCIDENT RELEASE PREVENTION AND RESPONSE POLICIES



Atlas Pipeline Mid-Continent LLC owns and operates a non-fractionating natural gas plant, the Driver Gas Plant, in Midland County, Texas. The plant is designed to process natural gas and recover liquid product from natural gas by physical separation and cryogenic means. Both petroleum condensates and natural gas liquid are recovered from the inlet pipeline gas in this process for offsite sales.



The Driver Gas Plant is a new facility; however, Atlas Pipeline Mid-Continent LLC has a long-standing commitment to workers and public safety. This commitment is demonstrated by our efforts in accident prevention, such as training personnel, quality assurance, and considering safety in the design, installation, operation and maintenance of our process. Our policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substances. However if a release does occur, facility trained personnel will evaluate the situation, take actions within the capabilities of the facility, and notify the necessary outside agencies. 



DESCRIPTION OF THE STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE



The Driver Gas Plant is located near Midkiff, Texas and operates a variety of processes to produce the following petroleum products: 



1.    Y grade mixture from natural gas

2.    Stabilized condensate

3.    Residue gas



The Driver Gas Plant is an expansion of the existing Driver Compressor Station and since work is still underway in the expansion there has not yet been a review or update of the facility's Emergency Response (ER) plan.



Also, because this is a new facility ER training has not yet occured for this facility's employees.
